questions.question: What problem does Osmosis solve?

answer.summary: Allocator decisions are spoken in meetings before they appear in databases.
details: Osmosis listens to those public conversations in real-time and turns them into predictive alerts—so you're first in the room with the right angle.
One $100M mandate at ~1% fees = ~$5M over five years. That's 1,000× our annual cost.
Our users regularly source $100M+ opportunities and see ~20% presentation hit rates (vs. ~5% industry norm).
answer.proof: While your competitors are reading last month's minutes, you're referencing yesterday's IC discussion.

questions.question: Day in the Life — From alert to mandate

answer.summary: See exactly how Osmosis transforms a morning alert into a closed mandate.

timeline.event: Email alert: Texas Teachers IC discussing increased private credit pacing from 5% to 8%.
details: Shows who said it (CIO vs consultant vs staff)
IC chair: Former Goldman, knows your senior partner
Consultant: Aksia, recently recommended similar strategy
Staff PM: Published paper on credit diversification
Loop in partner who knows IC chair

results.week2: Meeting booked (they're impressed you knew their timeline)
results.month3: RFP issued; you're already in dialogue

questions.question: Who is Osmosis for?

answer.summary: Heads of IR/Distribution at asset managers ($100M+ AUM) who are tired of learning about mandates from consultant memos.

power_users: Relationship managers hunting for warm leads
PMs who want to know who's actually deploying capital
RevOps teams who operationalize signals into pipeline
ready_indicators: You find out about mandates after competitors have pitched
Your team works from static databases, not live signals
Your presentation hit rate is stuck at 5-10%
You're losing to firms that 'somehow knew' about opportunities first

questions.question: What is Osmosis in one sentence?

answer.summary: Osmosis monitors public allocator meetings in real-time, using AI to extract who's allocating, what they said, and who influences decisions—then delivers personalized alerts with exact quotes and relationship maps to your team within hours, not months.

questions.question: What strategies and asset classes do you cover?

answer.summary: Full coverage across all alternative asset classes.
allocation_types: Manager graduations and emerging manager programs

questions.question: Why is 'real-time' better than comprehensive databases?

answer.summary: Databases are libraries. Osmosis is radar.

comparison.databases: Great for looking up last year's commitments
comparison.osmosis: Great for knowing who's committing next quarter

example.monday: Oregon IC discusses increasing PE allocation

outcome.before: Read about mandates → Chase RFPs → 5% hit rate
outcome.after: Hear signals → Call first → 20% hit rate

questions.question: We already have Preqin/PitchBook—why add Osmosis?

answer.summary: Keep them for history. Add Osmosis for what happens next.

add_osmosis_for.preqin: Tells you who manages $10B → Osmosis tells you who's deploying $500M next quarter
add_osmosis_for.pitchbook: Shows you contact info → Osmosis shows you what that contact said yesterday
add_osmosis_for.dakota: Lists consultant relationships → Osmosis alerts when consultants recommend your strategy

answer.proof: Databases ≠ signals. Use both. Osmosis makes your databases more valuable by telling you who to look up and when to call.

questions.question: What if my competitors are already using Osmosis?

answer.summary: Speed matters, but execution matters more.
details: Osmosis tells everyone the same facts—your differentiation is what you do with them.
We see teams using Osmosis consistently outperform those who don't, even when both have access.
Why? Because most firms still take weeks to act on intelligence. If you can move in days, you win.

questions.question: Where do signals come from?

answer.summary: 100% public information, 0% MNPI.
what_we_capture: Public pension board and investment committee meetings (live + same-day video)
CIO and staff interviews in public forums
Public filings and documents tied to allocation decisions
answer.proof: Every insight links to its public source for verification.

questions.question: What about international, endowments, foundations, and family offices?

answer.summary: Comprehensive US public plan coverage + any allocator speaking publicly worldwide.

breakdown.endowments: Captured when they publish meetings or speak at conferences
breakdown.sovereign: Covered when they release reports or officials speak publicly
breakdown.family_offices: Limited to public statements (rare but included when available)

questions.question: How do you ensure accuracy and prevent AI hallucinations?

answer.summary: Every alert includes references to the exact source. No hallucinations, just facts with receipts.
quality_measures: Speaker attribution: We know who said it (CIO vs consultant vs trustee)
Source links: Click through to exact timestamp or document page
Confidence scoring: We flag when we're uncertain
User verification: 'Report Issue' button with rapid review

questions.question: Do you handle MNPI? How is customer data treated?

answer.summary: No MNPI—ever. We only process publicly available information.
data_policy: Customer watchlists and notes are ring-fenced
Not used to train models (unless you explicitly opt in)
Full audit trail of who sees what
answer.proof: Used by compliance teams at 15+ major funds. Zero compliance issues in 3 years of operation.

questions.question: How fast is onboarding?

answer.summary: Under 2 minutes. Accept invite → AI builds your watchlist → alerts start flowing.
answer.proof: No engineering required. No IT tickets. No data migration. Just results.

questions.question: What integrations do you support?

answer.summary: Instant email alerts, web app, and CRM integration in 1 hour.
instant: Web app with search and filters

data_pushed: Signal type (pacing change, new search, consultant rec)

questions.question: How do you justify the cost?

answer.summary: One mandate pays for 1,000 years of Osmosis.

math.roi: 100× on one win, 1,000× if you win 10

customer_quotes: Paid for itself in the first month
One meeting covers the annual cost
Should be 10× the price based on value
answer.proof: Scaled by team size, not AUM. Everyone from emerging managers to $100B platforms can access the same intelligence.

questions.question: What's your maturity model? How do I know if we'll succeed?

answer.summary: If you're Level 1 or 2, Osmosis can 3× your speed to market.

levels.name: Reactive (Industry norm)
indicators: Learn about mandates from RFPs or news

questions.question: Can I see what my competitors are doing?

answer.summary: Yes, when they present in public.
what_you_see: Who else presented at recent board meetings
When competitors get mentioned in meetings
answer.what_you_dont: Private interactions, closed-door discussions, or anything that wasn't said publicly
answer.proof: You'll know the competitive landscape before the RFP drops, not after.

questions.question: What proof can you share?

answer.summary: Real metrics from real usage.

testimonial.quote: I've sourced two $100M+ opportunities from Osmosis in the past month.
testimonial.author: Aaron, Relationship Manager

questions.question: What's your security posture?

answer.summary: Enterprise-grade security with full compliance framework.
security: Encryption in transit and at rest

questions.question: What's next if we're interested?

answer.summary: Three ways to see value immediately.
options: 15-minute preview — We'll show you today's signals for your strategy
Free coverage check — See exactly what we track for your focus areas
Live signals — See allocator moves from this week
answer.proof: We're confident in our ROI math. If you can't see the value in 15 minutes, we'll tell you ourselves.
